posts.post_content: Just the guy. . . . . . er dead flying lizard to finish the job your [necropede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=necropede)s [plague stinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=plague stinger) and [ichorclaw myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ichorclaw myr)s begun. evasion? check. haste? check. resilience to a good amount of removal including lethal damage? check. throw in an accelerant like [ancient tomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ancient tomb) or [dark ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dark ritual) for legacy, and [everflowing chalice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=everflowing chalice) plus a good proliferate system for standard, and you can really watch this sucker fly. and the flavor. . . there is nothing to not love about a skeleton dragon legend that kills using the sexiest mtg wincon known to man :-)
posts.html:

posts.post_content: When a creature has zero or less toughness it is put into its owner's graveyard as a state based effect, it's not a sacrifice or destruction, regenerate won't protect you, [Tajuru Preserver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tajuru Preserver) won't protect you. Really it's the same type of effect as when a player loses the game for having no life.

posts.post_content:
There are other uses for Angels, Dragons, and Demons than Kaalia of the Vast.  
They're just not as good. Watch- Kaalia and Skittles are going to rip a new hole in everyone   
who isn't ready for it. :D  
  
Autocorrect Fail: Skyrim, the Blight Dragon  
  
This guy pretty much is the iconic Black Dragon in MTG now. By DnD standards, theoretically all Black Dragons should be Poisonous...and he actually is.   
  
Red: [Shivan Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shivan Dragon)  
Blue: [Keiga, the Tide Star](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keiga, the Tide Star)  
White: [Eternal Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternal Dragon)?  
Black: [Skithyrix,, the Blight Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skithyrix,, the Blight Dragon)  
  
There aren't really any iconicly GREEN Dragons that are just Green, but we can cheat and count [Rith, the Awakener](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rith, the Awakener).
posts.html:

Posted By: Arachnos (1/12/2013 3:26:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Another example of taking a set mechanic and plastering it over as many facets of the game as possible.  
  
This card combines the MTG trope of legendary dragons with the trope of [Drudge Skeletons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drudge Skeletons), with the new Infect mechanic as a rider on the whole package. As an added feature, they made this card yet another non-red card with the *Haste* mechanic; haste on black creatures is generally found on efficient, hard to kill black nasties like [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast). The last time we got a black dragon was also one of the last times we got a dragon with *haste* and *regeneration*! Remember [Hellkite Overlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellkite Overlord)?
posts.html:
Another example of taking a set mechanic and plastering it over as many facets of the game as possible.

This card combines the MTG trope of legendary dragons with the trope of Drudge Skeletons, with the new Infect mechanic as a rider on the whole package. As an added feature, they made this card yet another non-red card with the Haste mechanic; haste on black creatures is generally found on efficient, hard to kill black nasties like Bloodghast. The last time we got a black dragon was also one of the last times we got a dragon with haste and regeneration! Remember Hellkite Overlord?
